CookieImageCaptchaService The cookie HTTP image captcha service does not rely on storing the id/answer locally, the generated challenge answer is ciphered and stored in a cookie to be deciphered and validated.

Package example.captcha Description

This package documentation describes the Captcha implementation in Greenfield Times.

Implementation

The captcha implementation in Greenfield Times is stateless. It functions by setting a cookie on the target browser with a DES encrypted version of the correct captcha value on every request to the servlet in charge of generating the images. The cookie is then transported back to the server when a comment POST occurs. Here verification is done by matching the user input with the cookie value.

To avoid the situation where an attacker knows a valid captcha/encryption pair, and repeatedly posts with it, each front server employs a burn list. The burn list keeps track of the 1000 latest correctly verified captchas on that front, and automatically flags repeat posts of these captchas as invalid.

In a load balanced scheme, this theoretically allows an attacker to succesfully submit N messages with the same captcha pair, where N is the number of fronts. After at most N succesful posts, each server will have the captcha in its burn list.

To further minimize the risk of multiple postings, sticky sessions may be employed, to force a user on to a front. The current implementation avoids this by default, for performance reasons.

Note that the Captcha solution will not work for users which have disabled cookies. A message encouraging the users to enable cookies to be able to comment is displayed instead.

How the picture is generated

The Captcha picture is generated by the DefaultCaptchaFactory. This engine supplies a number of default parameters to JCaptcha, which in turn generates the actual image. This can be customized to make the Captcha easier, or harder, to read.

Disabling Captcha

The Captcha can be both enabled and disabled by configuration of the content example.CaptchaSettingsConfig, which may be found under System Department → Forum Settings → Captcha Configuration.
